intro: Ferulago granatensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its branched stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules that contain seeds, and the plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Ferulago granatensis is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
